metadata.title: CVE-2015-0839 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The hp-plugin utility in HP Linux Imaging and Printing (HPLIP) makes iteasier for man-in-the-middle attackers to execute arbitrary code byleveraging use of a short GPG key id from a keyserver to verify printplugin downloads.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hpijs-ppds - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
hplip - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
hplip-data - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
hplip-gui - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
libhpmud0 - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
libsane-hpaio - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
printer-driver-hpcups - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
printer-driver-hpijs - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
printer-driver-postscript-hp - 3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hplip package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.14.3-0ubuntu3.4').
